perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a thirty-day notice of written termination one to the other ("Term").
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a five-day notice of written termination one to the other ("Term").
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination notice period to five days could be problematic under various state laws that require more reasonable notice periods for contract termination, particularly if the agreement involves significant ongoing obligations or investments. A five-day notice may be deemed unconscionably short, especially where winding down the relationship requires more time.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates general contract law principles regarding reasonable notice and good faith termination, which are interpreted differently in various states (e.g., California, New York) but often require more than 5 days for agreements of this nature.

perturbation.original_text: Said written approval must be given within five (5) business days of Talent's receipt or said usage shall be deemed unapproved.
perturbation.changed_text: Said written approval must be given within one (1) business day of Talent's receipt or said usage shall be deemed unapproved.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the approval period to one business day for commercial placements and press releases places an unreasonably short timeframe on Talent, potentially conflicting with state laws that require a reasonable opportunity to review and approve marketing materials, especially those involving the individual's likeness and endorsement. This is especially true given the potential for reputational damage from unapproved materials.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates right of publicity laws in states like Florida (where Talent resides, according to the contract) that emphasize control over one's image and likeness, as well as general contract law concerning reasonable opportunity to review and approve materials.

perturbation.original_text: A. ESSI shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Talent in the event Talent fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: A. ESSI shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to Talent in the event Talent fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within two (2) days of receipt of written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the cure period to two days and allowing for immediate termination upon notice could be considered unreasonable and potentially violate good faith and fair dealing principles in contract law. Most jurisdictions require a reasonable cure period depending on the nature of the breach. Two days may be insufficient, especially for breaches that require significant effort to remedy.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which is recognized in most US jurisdictions and requires parties to act honestly and fairly in the performance and enforcement of contracts. Short cure periods may be seen as a breach of this covenant.
